plptool

Class PLPArchitecture

  • java.lang.Object
    • plptool.PLPArchitecture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Architecture

    public abstract class PLPArchitecture
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class serves as a skeleton for the ISA's metaclass. The ProjectDriver class depends on the extension of this class to perform ISA specific actions such as creating an assembler, simulation routines, etc. See plptool.mips.Architecture for an example implementation. This class has access to the currently active ProjectDriver instance 'plp'

        public java.lang.String saveArchSpecificSimStates()

        Returns:
        Additional configuration string to save to plp.simconfig

      • restoreArchSpecificSimStates

        public void restoreArchSpecificSimStates(java.lang.String[] configStr)
        Set architecture-specific simulation configuration to the current open project driver. ProjectDriver.open() will pass an array of String tokens split with the string "::" as the delimiter. For example, the line in config file "foo::bar" will be passed on to this function as {"foo", "bar"} in configStr
        Parameters:
        configStr - Configuration string saved in plp.simconfig

      • listing

        public void listing()
        Called when the user requests for a program listing

      • newProject

        public void newProject(ProjectDriver plp)
        Called when a new project with the specified ISA has been called. This function is NOT called if the user provides a source file to import while creating a new project, e.g. if the user uses the '-c' command line from the terminal

      • init

        public void init()
        Init is called right after the architecture is instantiated

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup()
        Cleanup the mess the project might have done. This is called when the user changes the ISA for the project, or the project is closed

        cmd -
